_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The irrational ways to win the fruit [mn: Wrong view, wrong thought, wrong speech, wrong action, wrong livelihood, wrong effort, wrong mindfulness, and wrong immersion
Making a wish, not making a wish, both making and not making a wish, or neither making nor not making a wish
The rational ways to win the fruit (a ca: Right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right immersion
Making a wish, not making a wish, both making and not making a wish, or neither making nor not making a wish
The similes (a causal sequence) [mn126:1: Heaping sand in a bucket, sprinkling it thoroughly with water, and pressing it out
Pulling the horn of a newly-calved cow
Pouring water into a pot and churning it with a stick
Drilling a green, sappy log with a drill-stick
